treatment.description: Plants (30–)40–60+; herbage sometimes sparsely hairy. Stems single or loosely clustered (relatively stiff-erect). Leaves mostly proximal and mid cauline (basal smaller, usually withering before flowering). Phyllaries frequently black or purplish toward tips, sometimes with black hairs on abaxial faces.
treatment.habitat: damp or drying, loose, rocky sites in upper conifer associations and near timberline
